title.narrative: WASH OP 3 - STRENGTHENED GOVERNMENT CAPACITIES

description.narrative: By 2023, Government has the capacity at national and decentralized level to improve policy, planning, monitoring, coordination and resource leveraging of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme for equitable and sustainable access to climate resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services at scale, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, Government has the capacity at national and decentralized level to improve policy, planning, monitoring, coordination and resource leveraging of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme for equitable and sustainable access to climate resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services at scale

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, Government has the capacity at national and decentralized level to improve policy, planning, monitoring, coordination andresource leveraging of WASH programme for equitable and sustainable access to climate resilient WASH services at scale

description.narrative: Despite the regular turnover of key responsible staff at the Ministry in charge of WASH, UNICEF continued to support the Government to improve the WASH sector Enabling Environment. Achievements include enabling Madagascar to attend the virtual High-Level Meeting during the United Nations’ s General Assembly in how to achieve SDGs related to water, and the COP26. Also, UNICEF and partners undertook a Cost-Benefit Analysis of Value-Added Tax Exemption for Soap in Madagascar. The WASH Budget Brief for monitoring financial allocations and expenditures was finalised during 2021, and the sanimarket study and water resource climate-change impact studies were launched. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
